reviews.text: The Silver Cloud Inn is located along Puget Sound near Old Town. Selected this hotel based on its proximity to the University of Puget Sound for Parents Weekend. The hotel was clean and the daily breakfast ample. It's a quiet area with no other hotels nearby. There is a walking/biking trail right in front of the hotel that runs along the Puget Sound shoreline.The hotel extends over the water so the views of Puget Sound are wonderful. Parking can be a little challenging as it is located under the hotel’s pier and beam construction whereby one must be mindful of the concrete piers when maneuvering. While approximately 15-20 minutes from downtown Tacoma and a 45 minute drive from Seattle, the restaurant choices nearby precluded any need to venture into Tacoma. A short walk up the hill is Old Town, which has some shopping and a Starbucks. Overall, a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Second stay as good as the first...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here as a stopover at the end of an excellent journey of Washington state. We had to catch an early flight at SEATAC in the morning and were coming in from Lake Crescent and figured this would be a good starting point for our early departure. We were upgraded to the King deluxe and were very gracious for it. We had an excellent view of the harbor activities. We had a very quiet, clean and comfortable room. The staff was very helpful and answered all of the questions we had on the area. This is a very nice property to stay at and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Silver Cloud is certainly an unexpected delight and locale. Who knew Tacoma has this!?
reviews.title: nice surprise...and not so nice surpise!

reviews.text: Sitting over the water, the views are amazing and the general quality and cleanliness of the hotel is quite good. Staff are well meaning and friendly. Beds and bedding were first rate. Rooms are adequate in size.
reviews.title: Beautiful views from every room.

reviews.text: However, the main freight line of the BNSF railroad runs right across the street from the Inn which guarantees..LOTS of horn blasting, rumbling freight cars, low speed/high rumble engines...on an almost hourly schedule THROUGHOUT the night. So much for sweet dreams over gently lapping waters.
reviews.title: Wow! An unexpected gem!

reviews.text: There's not a lot of options in the Ruston area of Tacoma. We stayed here when visiting family in the Ruston area. The Silver Cloud Inn is a pretty good place. It is right on the waterfront, which is fun to walk along, especially for kids and dogs. We've stayed there on two different occasions and didn't mind the trains at night. My child actually liked to watch them go by during the day. The beds were comfortable and decor is very nice, updated and clean. My only complaint was the noisy fridge and air conditioner. But then again, I have troubles falling asleep with any noise. It's close to Point Defiance Park (and zoo), and close to downtown Tacoma. The breakfast is alright. The rooms are a little narrow, but very clean. I would definitely come here again.
reviews.title: A little expensive, but clean, efficient, and great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the last night of our vacation due to it's proximity to SeaTac (about 30 mins away). while still being scenic. We had booked a regular room but were pleasantly surprised when we opened up our room door and saw that we had been upgraded to one of the jacuzzi suites with fireplace, wet bar, and view of the Bay. Wow! The location was convenient as we could walk to the little Old Town area along the water for dinner. Otherwise we relaxed in the room and made use of the jacuzzi. The free breakfast was more than sufficient with waffles, yogurt, cereal, etc. Service was excellent and free parking was a bonus. We'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Yes, the rooms and view are excellent, and I can sleep through train noise. Staff was helpful on the whole, although not attentive to stock outs of what should have been easy items to keep on the breakfast buffet -- hot water, bananas, yoghurt. There are several breakfast choices but fewer healthy ones than I would have preferred, and, as mentioned, the healthy stuff disappeared, leaving sweet rolls for late comers.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but parking and breakfast are a hassle

reviews.text: The parking, while free, is really a drawback. The spaces are very narrow and awkward, as there is not enough room to back up and maneuver into them. Arriving in the evening is a risky operation, as the remaining spaces are empty because no one can figure out how to angle the car to get it into them.
reviews.title: Beautiful views & great room.

reviews.text: The hotel is situated jutting out into Commencement Bay. Beautiful views of the water and hills. Sunset was stunning, and could be viewed from a jacuzzi tub. The room was very comfortable. Breakfast was a little blah, but that's the worst that can be said about this lovely inn with an accommodating friendly staff.
reviews.title: A Neat Treat on The Water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, great accommodation and close to some really great restaurants. Unexpected bonus, Tuesday night complimentary drinks and canapes.
reviews.title: Unexpected delight!

reviews.text: The hotel juts out into Commencement Bay/Puget Sound. We viewed the Olympic Mountains. Walkway to public pier just footsteps away where we viewed seal and anemones at low tide.
reviews.title: Delightful. Location perfect.

reviews.text: Room very comfortable and welcome appetizers and drinks were nice. Breakfast fine as well. Would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Awesome location, great hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way in to seattle and our way out. The first night we paid for a deluxe suite and had a great ocean view and the room was outstanding. Flat screen tv, fridge, comfy king bed, and really good free breakfast.
reviews.title: "Lovely waterfront location"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second time we stayed 3 days later, we actually bid for it on priceline. When we saw silvercloud inn picked up our bid we seriously jumped up and high fived with excitement. We assumed our room would be crappier and no view since it was half the price of the first night we stayed but we were fine with that. Instead, the room had an ocean view again and was just as awesome as the first time. Maybe just lucky but we were very pleased.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Please don't stay at this hotel. I had been a customer here for over a year when I checked in in May 2011 - everything went wrong and it was completely due to a new manager at the hotel - and while I tried to deal with the issues w/him, he simply stonewalled me. And, while I'm sure some of the issues were my fault, the manager (Dan) refused to even talk to me in person - he actually called me on the phone and did not want to speak to me in person until I insisted. I even went so far as to apologize to employees of the hotel whom he said I had offended (I have stayed around the world and never been accused of this). I complained to corporate at Silver Cloud and they indicated that "your file" at Silver Cloud indicated... excuse me? am I a high school student on whom Silver Cloud keeps a file? I loved this hotel and had received great service until this trip... So, the only issue I could figure is the new manager - in fact, I was approached by no less than three employees on my departure who told me they were very sorry, that "it's not you, it's the new manager..." In any event, I would not stay at this hotel! ever again.
reviews.title: No Silver Lining in This Silver Cloud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good boutique hotel built out over the water on the pilings of an old industrial pier. Nice views and saltwater ambience. Walking distance to several waterfront restaurants along good walking paths by the water. Complimentary beer, wine and pupus in the evening at manager's reception. And a free continental breakfast in the lobby in the morning. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Wifi in room. The rail line does go alongside the road iby the hotel, both passenger and freight, but it reminded me of my youth living next to the Illinois Central line.
reviews.title: Good Waterside Location in North Tacoma

reviews.text: I was surprised that the king rooms were actually quite small. Upon arrival, it smelled a tad musty, probably because although the sheets were very clean, the pillows hadn't been laundered recently. The location of course is perfect with wonderful water views on both sides, though the king rooms do have the parking lot just below whereas the deluxe king rooms don't. As has already been pointed out by another reviewer, the ventilation is extremely noisy but other than that, it is quiet. Breakfast was far better than I had expected, with a good choice of pastries, bagels, make your own waffles, eggs, sausages, fresh oranges and bananas, yoghurts. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful: since the complimentary shuttle was 'on its day off', we had 2 taxi fares within a 5 mile radius refunded. All in all, a good address in Tacoma, near seafood restaurants and quite conveniently located.
reviews.title: Small rooms, good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up here because our first two choices were sold out, but we are so glad we did. I think this hotel has a much more appealling location than in downtown yet it is only two miles from the Museum of Glass and close to all other area attractions. The location on a pier jutting out into the bay provides fantastic views to all of the rooms.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with a great view.

reviews.text: We had a suite in a "premium" location. These suites are at the water end of the hotel and since they cost only a few dollars more than the standard suites I'd recommend going for it. We were on the second floor and never heard anything through the walls from other guests. We did hear slamming doors though, so it isn't completely soundproof, but it is better than most hotels. I would avoid the rooms on the first floor if you can because they are located along a noisy corridor leading from the elevator to the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Views and Service

reviews.text: The Silver Cloud Inn sits a along Puget Sound near Old Town. We selected this hotel based its proximity to the University of Puget Sound. The hotel was clean and the daily breakfast ample. Parking can be a little challenging as it is located under the hotel’s pier and beam construction whereby one must be mindful of the concrete piers when maneuvering. While approximately 15-20 minutes from downtown Tacoma, the restaurant choices nearby precluded any need to venture into Tacoma. A short walk up the hill is Old Town, which has some shopping. Overall, we experienced a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Spectacular setting on Puget Sound

reviews.text: Magnificent view, friendly staff, free Internet, hot breakfast, comfortable room and what more you would require for one business hotel. Everybody in my group love it. We booked 4 rooms and are very satisfied with all this hotel can offer. Definitely a small but great hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: This hotel is on a beautiful site, basically a pier built out into Puget Sound. The views are terrific. It is clean, bright, with excellent rooms. It isn't inexpensive, but you can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent value

reviews.text: The Inn is on a private pier. Our well kept room was very acceptable with a great westerly view of Tacoma's Ruston Way waterfront park, from the 3rd floor near the far end of the Inn. The mattress was very comfortable. The room ventilation fan is noisy but we adapted quickly. The FULL complementary breakfast, with a view, was great. The lounge adjacent to the lobby is a very quiet and comfortable place to work with your laptop or just relax. The private Inn wireless internet has a strong signal in all areas. The few young guests I observed were 15 and older, and well behaved. I mostly observed and talked to friendly adults on leisure or business - or both. The staff is very professional and friendly. Free Inn parking is readily available near all secured entrances. There is no valet parking, which I like - I was in/out often. Travel anywhere is quick and easy. The Inn has a shuttle van - upon request. Step outside and exercise or relax along the 2-mile waterfront. with restaurants. There is a complementary Tuesday afternoon reception with wine, beer, etc. I live in Tacoma but felt like I was on vacation elsewhere during our home wood floor restoration project. This is, “my cup of tea.”
reviews.title: An excellent choice for adult travel or leisure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Tacoma Silver Cloud--it's in a beautiful location sticking out into Puget Sound but it has serious noise problems. First, the ventilation system is very noisy. We were told that this is the case in all/most/many (not sure which of those) rooms and they could do nothing about it. They suggested we turn off the unit, which we did, and the noise was gone. But that meant we had to open the windows, and the hotel is right across the street from a fairly busy railroad line. While the room was quite nice, I wouldn't stay here again unless some change were made to reduce noise.
reviews.title: Very noisy ventilation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like ocean views, so we thought we'd give this hotel a try. We were not disappointed!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location. Love the bay windows!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Like floating on water

reviews.text: LOCATION: The hotel juts out into the bay, so every room has a nice ocean view. It is also fairly easy to get to from the interstate. There are many restaurants within walking distance....and the walk itself is wonderful, as it is right along the water. Also, don't let Tacoma's "old" reputation scare you. It has undergone a huge facelift over the years, and was a very attractive and scenic place to stay.
reviews.title: wonderful friendly enviroment, horrible wi fi is the main issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: Large, clean, attractive. And best of all, LARGE windows that open up to the bay! The room we had was a king room. I'm not sure if all king rooms have bay windows, but ours did. We just loved it! There is a very comfortable chair and ottoman and we positioned it so we were looking out into the bay. Just wonderful!
reviews.title: We love this hotel.

reviews.text: LOBBY/BREAKFAST: It has hot food in addition to the usual continental fair. But what made it even more pleasent was the way the eating area was designed to look like someone's living room! What a great way to begin the day.
reviews.title: Wow! On the Water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place to stay in Tacoma. Just a couple of blocks from Old Town and beautiful, well-kept homes. The hotel is right on the water, actually right over the water would be more correct. Water view from every room! Staff is very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast bar in the morning has a great selection...love the waffles with strawberries. Would have enjoyed one more comfy chair in the room since the view is so great! Also a bit overpriced...ask for any promotional specials. We were able to get one.
reviews.title: On the Water...Really!

reviews.text: This is a place we would definately come back to on another visit to the Northwest.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Tacoma

reviews.text: Just spent 10 days here with my wife. Its got fantastic views across the bay - the breakfast adequate for continental style and the rooms a decent size. We never heard the trains although it was great at breakfast time counting how many trucks were being pulled by passing trains. Its a nice walk along the front to the local restaurants which all serve good food at reasonable prices. I recommend harbour Lights - nice and simple!!! Point Defiance park & zoo is only a short drive away and well worth a visit. There is also Martins restaurant by the ferry crossing - ace food and drink - well worth a visit. Downtown Tacoma is not worth the waste of petrol to get there - its all offices and a giant courthouse. Go and visit Mt Rainier - fantastic!!!
reviews.title: Comfortable, Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know what the gripe is with the parking... I had a Chevy Impala hire car (a biggish car) and parked in quite a few places without any problems!!!
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a nice place to stay. The staff are always polite and helpful. We have to go back in October - this is where we are staying again!!!
reviews.title: For the money, look no further.

reviews.text: About 9 months ago I moved away from beautiful Tacoma to a different part of Washington state. Fortunately, my job brings me back from time to time. My last time back I was fortunate enough to get a good deal on the Silver Cloud Inn. My initial reaction when I parked to go check in was that it was in a beautiful location. The hotel is situated right on the water and captures scenic views of Brown's Point and Commencement Bay. The staff acknowledged me immediately when I walked through the door. The young men behind the counter were professional and courteous. I was checked in in less than 5 minutes. I went to move my car closer to my room and that is where I found my first complaint about the hotel. The parking is limited and the parking lot itself is very tight. If you can, I would avoid bringing a large SUV to this location.
reviews.title: A silver lining in Tacoma

reviews.text: The room was well appointed and taking into account where my room was situated, I think that most of the rooms have a decent view. In the evenings I would open my window so I could hear the lapping of the water onto the shore - which lulled me into great sleep ... until the noise of the people fishing on the pier outside my window woke me later. That is obviously not the hotel's fault, but be forewarned that there is an unsavory element to some of the people who fish off of that pier. I walked over there at about 7 pm, in full daylight, and still felt a little uneasy about being alone.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Enjoyable

reviews.text: On other thing that I think is important in a hotel is a good shower and Silver Cloud definitely has that covered. No spotty water pressure, no loss of hot water and it didn't take more than a 30 seconds to a minute for the water to heat up.
reviews.title: Nice Waterfront Hotel

reviews.text: Really, this is a great place to stay, both for business and for leisure.
reviews.title: Such a great hotel, highly recommend!

reviews.text: Stayed in a one bedroom king suite, with two other adults. I slept on the fold out couch - it was comfortable. I couldn't believe how comfortable it was. The room was big and the windows over looked the water. The windows also opened up and it was wonderful listening to the birds and sea life. Some time out side noise was noisy, do to the pier is right next to hotel where locals fish. Once we closed the windows you could not hear anything. The hotel does not have a pool or gym, but it is right on the water and your can walk or jog the miles of path along the water. Resturants of all prices in walking distances. Stayed on a Friday for 4 nights. Great place for couples to get away, but nothing for kids to do at Inn. Breakfast was very good and the service and staff wonderful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great staff
